articles.title: GRAINS-Wheat at 1-week high on Argentina crop woes, easing recession fears
articles.description: SINGAPORE, July 8 (Reuters) - Chicago wheat futures jumped 2% and touched a one-week high on Friday, building on the previous session's rally, as easing concerns over a global recession and worries over lower production in Argentina underpinned the market.Corn and soybeans rose for a third consecutive session.FUNDAMENTALS* The most-active wheat contract on the Chicago Board of

articles.title: Canadians lose 7-1 to world No. 2 Argentina at women's field hockey World Cup
articles.description: TERRASSA, Spain — North Vancouver's Grace Delmotte scored on her Canadian debut but Argentina reeled off seven straight goals Thursday to defeat Canada 7-1 at the women's field hockey World Cup. No.

articles.title: Watch out T-rex! New giant dino with tiny arms discovered
articles.description: A new dinosaur, Meraxes gigas, was recently discovered in the Patagonian region of Argentina with short arms reminiscent of a Tyrannosaurus rex.
articles.content:
A new giant dinosaur was recently discovered in the Patagonia region of Argentina with short arms reminiscent of a Tyrannosaurus rex.
This dino is being called Meraxes gigas and was found to be 36-feet long and weighing over four tons, according to a... [1517 chars]

articles.title: Argentina eases FX access for fertilizer imports amid supply concerns
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, July 7 (Reuters) - Argentina's central bank on Thursday said it has improved foreign exchange market access for imported fertilizers, phytosanitary products and car parts, amid supply concerns in the grain exporting powerhouse.The central bank reduced the term for access to the foreign exchange market to 60 days from 90 days previously.It also reduced to 60 days
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, July 7 (Reuters) - Argentina's central bank on Thursday said it has improved foreign exchange market access for imported fertilizers, phytosanitary products and car parts, amid supply concerns in the grain exporting powerhouse.

articles.title: UPDATE 2-Argentina's wheat-planting seen edging down due to bad weather
articles.description: (Adds exchange quotes, corn harvest figures)BUENOS AIRES, July 7 (Reuters) - Argentina's wheat-planting area for the current 2022/2023 harvesting season is estimated at 6.2 million hectares (15.3 million acres), down from the 6.3 million hectares previously estimated, the Buenos Aires grains exchange said on Thursday.The cut is the fourth made by the exchange since the season
articles.content:
(Adds exchange quotes, corn harvest figures)
